subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Unicode proposal again.
msgSnippet: ... Surely the fact that the deviser intended QS not to be a set of alternatives within Shavian or an extension of it, but a *replacement* for it ought to have
messageBody:
On 29.5.2007 Michael Everson wrote:
> At 01:37 -0400 2007-05-29, Ph.D. wrote:
>>> I've been very busy lately, and I don't have time to
>>> look into this right now, but my first impression is
>>> that unifying Quikscript with Shavian makes the same
>>> mistake originally made in unifying Coptic with Greek.
>
> Except that Quikscript is a revision of Shavian made by
> the deviser of Shavian.

Surely the fact that the deviser intended QS not to be a set
of alternatives within Shavian or an extension of it, but a
*replacement* for it ought to have some weight? Also people
don't pick and choose among the Shavian or QS characters,
but use either the one or the other system.

After all we don't unify Latin or Cyrillic with Greek
because they grew out of it? That's exactly the mistake made
with Greek and Coptic. The only difference is that
*historically* Coptic was a proper superset of Greek, but so
was Cyrillic originally, but QS never was a proper superset
OR subset of Shavian.

As for identity of deviser, that is alleged to be the case
also with Armenian and Georgian, but they are not unified
because of that! (See
<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saint_Mesrob>)

/BP -- who even thinks that unifying Germanic and
Scandinavian runes may have been a mistake...
